item.title: ğŸ” Introducing the LinkedIn Recent Shares Button Extension
item.description: As a hobby software developer, I am always looking for ways to improve my workflow and make my job easier. Recently, I decided to try my hand at creating a Chrome extension to help me navigate LinkedIn more efficiently. The Goal The goal of my extension was to add a new button to LinkedIn profile pages that would allow me to quickly view a person’s recent shares. I thought this would be a useful feature because it would save me from having to navigate through multiple menus and pages to see someone’s recent activity.

item.title: ğŸ” I Made A Password Generator App
item.description: I made this little Password Generator App Want to see me create more? Feel free to join me on Linkedin

item.title: ğŸ‘€ Understanding ReactJS
item.description: So, I’ve been learning Web Development for several months and things are moving very, very slowly, but surely. Before I restarted my journey of getting into learning to code I had an understanding of how the web worked and was familiar with HTML, CSS and a little JavaScript (aka Script-Kiddie). This was a huge benefit when I started to create my first websites again in 2021. But then came ReactJS.

item.title: ğŸ”¨Slow Webflow Site Because Of A Embedded Youtube Video? Here's Your Fix
item.description: Have you embedded a youtube video via iframe in your Webflow site and suddenly your page speed is super slow? Especially on mobile? Worry no more, hereâ€™s how you can fix it. Setup Lets first look at the iframe you are embedding in Webflow <iframe width="768" height="396" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/QYAwFBGb-5U" rel="0" enablejsapi="1" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" ></iframe> Problem The problem with this code is, that the video content of the iframe is loaded directly with the whole page.

item.title: ğŸ” Restart
item.description: After changing systems I accidentally deleted my local files for this website. ğŸ¤¯ Here’s what happened. After about 5 years I bought myself a new laptop. I had been working with 2 systems on my old laptop Linux & Windows. I saved my development files for my website locally and thought they are synced with the cloud. Well, turns out they were not. So I cleared my old system thinking I have a backup for everything.

item.title: ğŸ‘¨ğŸ½â€ğŸ’» Weekly Coding Reflection CW 30
item.description: Why I am doing this: I have noticed, that I am not coding as much as I would like to. To solve this problem and stay accountable to myself, I will write a weekly coding reflection. Morale 7/10 Currently focussing on Learning the fundamentalf of ReactJS. What I did & learned Project: getUp - React App I managed to save the data the user enters in the counter of the ReactJS App in the local storage of the browser.

item.title: ğŸ”® The Randomness of Viral Posts
item.description: What do Gangnam Style, Justin Bieber and Nathan Apodaca have in common? For different reasons, they all cracked the social media algorithm leading to overnight fame. Or, in simpler words: They went viral. Going viral is the goal of many creators. Itâ€™s the reason countless online professionals lost their jobs and or minds and some might even argue lives. It can lead to success at the speed of light or shed (unwanted) attention on people or topics.

item.title: ğŸª¶ June '22 Reflection
item.description: Overview The last month was a colorful box mixed with a wide range of experiences. First, I started working as a Group Fitness Trainer again. This does get tricky in addition to my consulting work when it comes to balancing my time. Second, I neglected my business project as I had to prioritize my paid work. Third, a range of private meetings and personal obligations took a toll on my productivity.

item.title: ğŸ“ May '22 - Reflection
item.description: Overview It’s strange looking back. I started my entrepreneurial journey 1 year ago. A lot has happended since then. But one thing has not changed: My willingness to continue my entrepreneurial journey. A hard path to walk I have had a few inquires about fulltime positions, but notice that I do not resonate with them at the moment. Being a self funded founder is by no means easy. I am still struggling with regular income streams and have not cracked this nut yet.

item.title: âœğŸ¾ April '22 - Reflection on the past month(s)
item.description: Overview After nomading for some months I’m back at home and needed some time to settle back in. It’s strange how fast the hometown can become unfamiliar. My travelling was split into two journeys which taught and showed me vastly different ways of living. Here’s what I mean 1. Living in alignment I spent the first 3 months on the canary islands and was surrounded by nature all day. It was amazing having the opportunity to watch the sun go up and down and have the opportunity to go surfing nearly every day.

item.title: ğŸ˜µâ€ğŸ’« Learning Full Stack Web Development - Month 3
item.description: You know how everyone tells you things do not always go as expected? Well, that’s exactly what I am experiencing right now. I kind of lost track of The Odin Project. Here`s why: Loosing focus After learning about JavaScript Classes & ES6 Modules I had a hard time grasping the concepts, but just sticked with the material. I was just learning about Webpack, as I stumpeld upon a Job that seemed to be a perfect fit for me.

item.title: ğŸœï¸ I Made a Game About The Hallucinogenic Mexican Cactus Peyote Thatâ€™s Going Extinct
item.description: Iâ€™ve spent the last months digital nomading through Mexico. During my travels I learned about the indigenous people of Mexico that use a cactus for healing and ceremonial purposes. The cactus is called peyote and itâ€™s been used for hundreds of years. In the past decade many people from all over the world have also started to engage in peyote ceremonies in Mexico. This has led to peyote being an endangered plant.

item.title: ğŸƒ My Digital Detox Experience - LinkedIn
item.description: I tried a digital detox from LinkedIn for 3 months. In this article I am reflecting on my experience. Here’s what happened. Let’s start with: What is a digital detox? Digital detox is a trending topic that seems everywhere these days. The term “Digital Detox” means different things to different people and as a result, it is often misunderstood. From my experience it boils down to the following: Getting away from technology for a specific amount of time

item.title: ğŸ‘¨ğŸ¾â€ğŸ’» Learning Full Stack Web Development (for free) - My Second Month
item.description: “You can learn anything” - Khan Academy What happened So I finished The Odin Projects Fundamentals and had fun creating a Rock, Paper, Scissors Game. I was really surprised at level of depth of the fundamentals course. Not only did I repeat HTML & CSS Basics, but I also dived into Git and already started with JavaScript. What I really liked is, that the program puts a heavy emphasis on the psychological aspect of learning.

item.title: ğŸ§™ğŸ¾â€â™‚ï¸ Rumi Quote on Change
item.description: â€œYesterday I was clever so I wanted to change the world. Today I am wise so I am changing myself.â€ - Rumi

item.title: ğŸ¨ JavaScript Frameworks? Read this.
item.description: Framework noun /ËˆfreÉªm.wÉËk/ a supporting structure around which something can be built – Definition by Cambridge Dictionary Ever since the advent of JavaScript in the mid-90â€™s, developers have been struggling to find a solution for creating reusable code that can be easily be implemented in different projects. via GIPHY Originally, frameworks were meant to address this problem by providing developers with more control over how their applications would run.

item.title: ğŸ‘¨ğŸ¾â€ğŸ’» Learning Full Stack Web Development for Free - My First Month
item.description: Here’s the tldr; of the article pic.twitter.com/Qglih3gNgc — Kass ğŸ¦ˆ (@KassandraSanch) November 16, 2021 You are probably wondering what this meme means. Well, let’s start at the beginning. What does Full Stack Web Development mean? I’ll cover the basics in this part. Even if you have a basic understanding of web development I will show you an interesting way to explain this to your parents. Let’s dive straight in. The term ‘Web Development’ is something your parents will understand if they have heard of the internet.

item.title: ğŸ”„ Changes I am making on remotenactive.com
item.description: After analyzing my startup and talking to friends and mentors I have decided to make the following changes to my remote team building websiet remotenactive.com. Set all content to free, no more paid or subscriber content Focus on content, not on the service anymore Goal: Create a online media company For more real-life updates feel free to join me on twitter.

item.title: ğŸ•¹ï¸ I Made a Simple RPS Game
item.description: Rock Paper Scissors - Game I made a simple a simple rock papers scissors game of 5 rounds with a dynamic background and the option to play music. It’s a fun little project I made to learn JavaScript. You can play it here For more real-life updates feel free to join me on twitter.

item.title: December and 2021 Review
item.description: This review will be a little different. I will not review each and every to do item and see whether I managed to achieve my goals. I will take a broader look at the last month and whole year went. And also dive into some topics that are relevant to me. Reflection on my startup In December I did not manage to make any money with my startup. I have been working heavy on SEO and creating content, in addition to doing Sales mainly via outreach on LinkedIn.

item.title: "Stop measuring days by degree of productivity and start experiencing them by degree of presence" - Alan Watts
ğŸš« Validating Startup Ideas Does Not Work
item.description: "Validating" a business idea is like trying to validate a poker hand. It just doesn't make any sense. — Daniel Vassallo (@dvassallo) December 14, 2021 The concept of “validating a business idea” creates a false sense of security. The example by Daniel Vassallo shows this in several dimensions. In a game of poker, you can only make calculated guesses, based on probability, experience, and the attempt of analyzing your opponent.

item.title: ğŸ“ November Review + Reflection on The Past 7 Months
item.description: Overview Note: The review is mainly regarding my work on remotenactive.com I’ve finally kickstarted a digital hub in November. I’m getting into the habit of putting out content regularly, but I’ve already noticed, that I must increase the amount and speed of content production. I’ll get into why in a second. As I have to balance in my marketing freelance work and many other tasks as a solo-founder as sales, billing & finances, administration, webhosting issues, marketing, research, target audience outreach etc.

item.title: ğŸ“ October Review
item.description: Overview Note: The review is mainly regarding my work on remotenactive.com October taught me to let go. I let go of the idea that I will be creating everything from the ground up. I let go of expecting potential new business to manifest. I let go of the fear of launching an unperfect product. I let go of the comfort of my known surrounding. I let go of the co-working space I was attending.

item.title: ğŸ‘» Ghost CMS l A Short Review (2021)
item.description: Before you skim through this article, let me make one thing clear: I do not hate WordPress. Why would I, there are endless possibilities, right? Well, in my eyes, all the possibilities have led to an overloaded system. The type of system that is slow, or stops moving. This is the reason I do not work with WordPress. Nope, not even for a tiny little project. I learned how to create a website, but when it comes to handling users & payment, I saw this will take me a lot of time to create on my own.

item.title: â˜” Flashback 2 - It's Getting Messy
item.description: Note: This article was first published on 07.02.21 As promised, I will open up the micro start up garage door wider, so you can see what’s actually happening behind the scenes on a day to day basis. So, let’ start with What actually happened last week? Things have gotten pretty messy, as I am balancing my January project on the one hand and starting out my February project on the other.

item.title: ğŸ“ September Review
item.description: Overview Note: The review is regarding part of my work and only displays a look into a facet of a project and does not include all income/revenue I generate ğŸ™ğŸ½ After months of hard work and no full free weekend, I finally took 5 days off in September. ğŸ§˜ğŸ½â€â™‚ï¸ Prioritizing mental health and re-energizing is crucial, but often neglected as a founder. ğŸ¤¯ There are so many stories of founders’ burnout, and it happens faster than one thinks.

item.title: ğŸ”Œ Flashback 1 - How a power cut nearly ruined 3 weeks of hard work
item.description: Note: This article was first published on 31.01.21 The last weeks have been quite a adventurous ride for me. On the day I launched my January product I had a power cut in my house. Yeah, a real one. Didn’t charge my laptop over night - 30% battery. No Electricity No Wifi. Nice. But, I’ll get to that in a bit. Let us start with the question of Why am I actually doing this stuff?

item.title: âš¡ Flashback 0 - My One Micro Startup Per Month-Challenge
item.description: Starting the fist step from â€œI have an ideaâ€ to actually doing stuff is really hard. There’s term and a whole discussion around people who only have business ideas, but never act on them: “Wannapreneur” While there are many different opinions on what differentiates a “Wannapreneur” from an Entrepreneur I think these 3 key aspects get you caught in the “Wannapreneur”-Cycle Thinking and talking about your idea/s without actually acting on them Consuming way too much Online Content ( Hi, GaryVee!

item.title: ğŸ“ August Review
item.description: Overview Note: The review is regarding part of my work and only displays a look into a facet of a project and does not include all income/revenue I generate August was the month of hard and sweaty client work. I was really lucky and grateful to close 3 clients at the end of july. Whereby I helped 2 clients with remote team building and one with remote workflow and documentation.

item.title: ğŸ“ˆ Sitestats August
item.description: Hi there, I try not to overemphasize the numbers of this website, as the main goal is to keep myself accountable by publishing my progress. Nevertheless, here are some insights on the traffic. Time 01.05.21 - 21.08.21 Overall Traffic Pages Interesting, that my longest piece of content is also the best-performing so far. --- For more real-time updates feel free to join me on Twitter Linkedin

item.title: ğŸª Keeping a clear mind as a solo-founder
item.description: Going on a solo-adventure has many upsides. Full flexbility. No one to account to. Moving quickly. But, there are certain risks. Imagine you are hiking on your own. ğŸš¶ğŸ¾â€â™‚ï¸ The colourful mountains are illuminated by the sun. The wind breeze is seemingly playing music on your clothes. ğŸŒ„ You feel fully energized about going some extra miles and run up the hill and simply just do as you please. Amazing.

item.title: ğŸ“ July Review
item.description: Note: The review is regarding part of my work and only displays a look into a facet of a project and does not include all income/revenue I generate Overview It’s kind of strange. I’ve read a dozen times that things do not go as expected whilst starting a business. But now, that things really went different from my goals and plans it feels kind of weird. So, “bad” news first"

item.title: ğŸ£ From 0 to 1: Learnings From My First 3 Months of Switching Careers and Client Hunting
item.description: “Just start a service business”. Sounds pretty easy, right? Wrong. Going from a product-focused to a service-based business is more challenging than I expected. Here is why: I do not have an established network in the field I am diving into. I made two switches at once. From: Type of work: Full-time employee Field of work: Marketing To: Type of work: Self-Employed Field of work: Team Building Although I read about making a double switch not being recommendable I just went on and did it.

item.title: ğŸ’¡ Cal Newport On Control
item.description: â€œ Giving people more control over what they do and how they do it increases their happiness, engagement, and sense of fulfillment. â€ â€” Cal Newport

item.title: ğŸ“ June Review
item.description: Note: The review is regarding part of my work and only displays a look into a facet of a project and does not include all income/revenue I generate Greetings friend from the WWW, as mentioned in my earlier post I am going to publish my progress on a monthly basis. Progress is currently slow, but steady. Paid Media Experiment The Google Ads Campaign has brought traffic and one person booked an appointment via the website calendar.

item.title: ğŸ˜± I Soft Launched My Website and I'm Embarrassed
item.description: I get it. You want a good product. Yet, I have to launch early. And fast. Like really, really, really fast. “If You’re Not Embarrassed By The First Version Of Your Product, Youâ€™ve Launched Too Late” â€” Reid Hoffman Fast means accepting imperfection. This is why I decided to soft-launch Remote ’n Active - List on a Sub-Reddit yesterday. And talk to people from my target audience. And send it to a couple of friends.

item.title: ğŸ”¦ Show Don't Tell
item.description: As I’ve been seeing very low conversions on remotenactive.com I decided to post on IndieHackers.com in the Group “Landing Page Feedback”. I then got a reply from Jonathan Lee, who runs pagereview.io. He created a pagereview feedback page for me with really valuable feedback I must say, I think this is really cool. If I had a team, or more people working on the product/site, I would definitely give it a shot as it makes design critique really easy.

item.title: ğŸ”¥ r/startups (766k) Post Of The Day. Here's what I did
item.description: Yesterday, on the 14.06.2021 I got to the post of the day with 125 upvotes. Link to the post Here is how I created the post. Topic It’s not always easy to come up with topics to write about. I have been experimenting with different kinds of posts on LinkedIn and noticed one of my posts had a pretty high engagement. Here are the LinkedIn stats on my post about my learnings about attending the Y Combinator Free Startup School.

item.title: ğŸ§­ Tracking My Goals and other changes
item.description: I’ve been working out in public for nearly 6 weeks and have reflected on my learnings. Going on forward I will continue with these changes: Tracking my goals on a monthly, not weekly basis (weekly internally) Keeping my articles in english, german translation only on requests This will improve my public productivity and help me improve content creation, as certain work flows took up more time than expected (e.g. translating idioms into german or vice versa).

item.title: ğŸ“š What I learned in 12 weeks at YCombinators' Free Startup School
item.description: Why join a Startup School? School is boring after all. Or is it? Learning how to start and maintain a successful company within the boundaries of a school like system seems somewhat uncanny when you think of it. School was not always fun. Most of the things taught can often not be applied to the “real life”. Sir Ken Robinson even goes so far to say that the current education culture is a “Death Valley”.

item.title: âœ¨ Meaningful Connections
item.description: Social Media is often perceived as a superficial place were egomaniacs just try to show off how cool they are. That’s at least been my impression of some online communities. But, it really comes down to how you approach this way of communicating online. It really helps to view each and every person online as somebody you see at a party, event, on the street or in the supermarket. Even out there in the real world you come across colorful individuals.

item.title: âœ¨ Sinnvolle Verbindungen
item.description: Social Media wird oft als oberflÃ¤chlicher Ort wahrgenommen, an dem Egomanen nur versuchen zu zeigen, wie cool sie sind. Das war zumindest mein Eindruck von einigen Online-Communities. Aber es kommt wirklich darauf an, wie du diesen Kanal nutzt. Es ist wirklich hilfreich, jede einzelne Person online als jemanden anzusehen, den du auf einer Party, Veranstaltung, auf der StraÃŸe oder im Supermarkt siehst. Sogar da drauÃŸen in der realen Welt stÃ¶ÃŸt man auf bunte Individuen.

item.title: ğŸ“ Weekly Goals #2
item.description: Info Setting clear goals is crucial to make sure I am moving into the right direction and stay accountable. These are not all To Do’s, but rather the most important things I am working towards on a weekly basis. Mindset After talking to another founder I noticed my approach towards Sales was completely wrong. I am now adjusting towards creating meaningful online connections. Not slamming the door open and trying to sell.

item.title: ğŸ™‹ğŸ¾â€â™‚ï¸ Englisch, Bitte
item.description: Ich habe meine Hauptzielgruppe fÃ¼r remotenactive.com als aus Deutschland kommende Unternehmen definiert. Ich bin mir vÃ¶llig bewusst darÃ¼ber, dass das Thema international anpassbar ist, aber um mich so weit wie mÃ¶glich in eine Nische zu begeben, konzentriere ich mich derzeit auf den deutschen Markt. Es sind jedoch immer mehr Anfragen nach einer englischen Website bei mir aufgetaucht. Also begann ich darÃ¼ber nachzudenken, wie ich die Website Ã¼bersetzen kann, ohne Stunden mit der Entwicklung zu verbringen.

item.title: ğŸ™‹ğŸ¾â€â™‚ï¸ English, Please
item.description: I started out by defining my main target audience for remotenactive.com as being from Germany. I am fully aware that the topic is adaptable to an international audience, but to niche down as much as possible I am currently focussing on the German market. But, more and more requests for an English website have come up. “Is the website also in English?” So I started out thinking of ways how to translate the website without spending hours.

item.title: ğŸ•Šï¸ Der Preis der Freiheit
item.description: SelbstÃ¤ndig zu sein bringt die Illusion von vÃ¶lliger Freiheit, grÃ¼nem Gras, warmer Sonne, blauem Himmel den ganzen Tag wÃ¤hrend alle um dich herum “Kum ba yaaah” singen. Oder so Ã¤hnlich, denke ich. :) Die Annahme dabei ist: Mach was du willst. Kein plan. Kein Chef. Nice. Aber: totale FlexibilitÃ¤t kann zu Chaos fÃ¼hren. Das ist zumindest meine Erfahrung. Deshalb habe ich Arbeitsstrukturen und Gewohnheiten geschaffen, die mich verantwortlich und produktiv machen.

item.title: ğŸ•Šï¸ The Price of Freedom
item.description: Being self-employed comes with the illusion of total freedom, green grass, warm sun, blue sky all day and everyone around you singing “Kum ba yaaah”. Or something like that, I guess. :) The general notion is: Do as you please. No schedule. No boss. Nice. But: total flexibility can lead to chaos. That is my take at least. Which is why I have created working structures and habits that keep me accountable and productive.

item.title: ğŸ“ Weekly Goals #1
item.description: Setting clear goals is crucial to stay accountable as a founder. I have set overall business goals, but noticed I have to get a stronger focus. That is why I am setting weekly goals. These are not all To Do’s but rather the most important this I am working towards on a weekly basis. Business Sales: Digital outreach to at least 15 new prospects Get 2 Case Studies Talk to at least 2 prospects Website remotenactive.

item.title: ğŸ“ WÃ¶chentliche Ziele #1
item.description: Das Setzen klarer Ziele ist entscheidend, um sich als GrÃ¼nder selbst gegenÃ¼ber rechenschaftspflichtig zu sein. Ich habe allgemeine GeschÃ¤ftsziele festgelegt, aber festgestellt, dass ich mich stÃ¤rker fokussieren muss. Deshalb setze ich mir wÃ¶chentliche Ziele. Dies sind nicht alles Aufgaben die Anliegen, sondern die wichtigsten Ziele, auf die ich wÃ¶chentlich hinarbeite. Unternehmen Vertrieb: Digitale Kontaktaufnahme mit mindestens 15 neuen Interessenten 2 Case Studies erarbeiten Mit mindestens 2 Interessenten sprechen Website remotenactive.com

item.title: ğŸ‰ Remote Arbeit hat ein Problem, darum habe ich RemoteNActive gestartet
item.description: Meine erste Erfahrung mit Remote-Arbeit habe ich in meiner Marketing-TÃ¤tigkeit in Berlin in 2015 gemacht. Mein Agentur-Team war in Deutschland verteilt, unser Hauptkunde hatte sein Team in Deutschland, Europa und der USA. In 2017 habe ich dann auch ein wenig Erfahrung mit Digital Nomading gemacht und es geliebt. Besonders die FlexibilitÃ¤t und Freiheit zu entscheiden, wann und wo ich arbeite, hat mich begeistert. Das Jahr 2020 hat die Digitalisierung der deutschen Wirtschaft in einem noch nie dagewesenen MaÃŸe vorangetrieben.

item.title: ğŸ‰ Remote Work has a problem, which is why I started RemoteNActive
item.description: I’ve made my first experience with remote work as a marketeer in Berlin in 2015 with my agency team distributed across Germany, our main client with a team across Germany, Europe and the US. I then also did some digital nomading in 2017 and loved it. Especially the flexibility to choose when and where to work got me hooked. The year 2020 has pushed the digitization around the globe and especially in Germany to an unprecedented degree.

item.title: ğŸƒğŸ¾â€â™‚ï¸ Typeform Has Left the Chat
item.description: When Typeform first went live, I was absolutely thrilled. Suddenly, polls were fun and not that annoying anymore. The design was minimalistic, beautiful, playful, but still professional. But unfortunately, as with so many good technical products, it simply became more and more expensive over time and/or the free functionalities were increasingly restricted. Typeform is collecting dem cash The design and UX are still very good, but the starting price is very high at 30 â‚¬ / month (“Essential”).

item.title: ğŸƒğŸ¾â€â™‚ï¸ Typeform hat den Chat verlassen
item.description: Als Typeform neu herauskam war ich voll begeistert. PlÃ¶tzlich haben Umfragen SpaÃŸ gemacht. Das Design war minimalistisch, schÃ¶n, verspielt, aber doch professionell. Doch leider ist es dann wie mit so vielen guten technischen Angeboten mit der Zeit einfach immer kostspieliger geworden bzw. die kostenfreien FunktionalitÃ¤ten wurden immer weiter eingeschrÃ¤nkt. Typeform casht ab Das Design und UX sind immer noch sehr gut, doch der Einstiegspreis ist mit 30â‚¬ / Monat (“Essential”) sehr hoch.

item.title: ğŸ¤³ğŸ¾ Mobile First
item.description: I’ve read it so often, and I was really surprised, when I forgot about the mobile versions of my projects. Even in the advertising industry we often had the discussion of starting out with the mobile version of an ad or thinking about how the creative out will play out on mobile. Although I must say I have made the experience that consumer driven websites often indeed have a higher mobile share, but b2b oriented services or websites often have a slightly higher desktop/laptop share.

item.title: ğŸ¤³ğŸ¾ Mobile Zuerst
item.description: Ich habe es so oft gelesen und war wirklich Ã¼berrascht, als ich die mobilen Versionen meiner Projekte vergaÃŸ. Selbst in der Werbebranche hatten wir oft die Diskussion, mit der mobilen Version einer Anzeige zu beginnen oder darÃ¼ber nachzudenken, wie sich das die Kampagne auf mobilen GerÃ¤ten wirkt. Obwohl ich sagen muss, dass ich die Erfahrung gemacht habe, dass verbraucherorientierte Websites tatsÃ¤chlich hÃ¤ufig einen hÃ¶heren Anteil an MobilgerÃ¤ten aufweisen, B2B-orientierte Dienste hingegen aber hÃ¤ufig einen etwas hÃ¶heren Anteil an Desktops / Laptops aufweisen.

item.description: Nein sagen ist oft gar nicht mal so leicht. Deswegen nutze ich die Website “How to say no”, wenn ich mal hÃ¶flich eine Business-Anfrage absagen muss. Copy, Paste, ein, zwei WÃ¶rter anpassen. Et voilÃ Wieder mehr Zeit im Kopf fÃ¼r das Wesentliche.

item.title: ğŸ™…ğŸ¾â€â™‚ï¸ No
item.description: Saying no is often not that easy. That’s why I use the website “How to say no” when I politely have to deny a business request. Copy, paste, customize a word or two. Et voilÃ . More time in your head for the essentials.

item.title: ğŸ‘¨ğŸ¾â€ğŸ’» Learning UX Design Online: My Experience
item.description: Why it’s important to understand current technologies The Netflix documentary “The Social Dilemma” has impressively shown the manipulative influence of social media on our everyday life. Thereby one thing became clear: Not being informed can be dangerous. If you don’t understand how certain systems, apps, and websites work, you are more prone to manipulation. It used to be different, wasn’t it? Technologies have become an indispensable part of our everyday life.

item.title: ğŸ‘¨ğŸ¾â€ğŸ’» UX-Design Online Lernen: Meine Erfahrung
item.description: Warum es wichtig ist, aktuelle Technologien zu verstehen Die Netflix Dokumentation “The Social Dilemma” hat auf Eindrucksvolle Art und Weise den manipulativen Einfluss von Social Media auf unseren Alltag gezeigt. Dabei ist eins klar geworden: Unwissenheit kann gefÃ¤hrlich werden. Wenn du nicht verstehst, wie gewisse Systeme, Apps und Webseiten funktionieren, bist du anfÃ¤lliger fÃ¼r Manipulation. Dabei war es doch frÃ¼her alles anders, oder? Technologie ist aus dem aktuellen Alltag gar nicht mehr wegzudenken.

item.title: ğŸ’¡ Warum diese Seite so ist, wie sie ist
item.description: Mittlerweile gibt es ja Webseiten-BaukÃ¤sten wie Sand am Meer. Als ich mir die Frage gestellt habe, wie ich diese Webseite aufziehe, habe ich mir ziemlich schnell gedacht: “Auf keinen Fall mit Wordpress” Verstehe mich nicht falsch, Wordpress ist in manchen FÃ¤llen eine super LÃ¶sung. Nur eben nicht fÃ¼r meinen Bedarf. Ich wollte volle FlexibilitÃ¤t bei einem mÃ¶glichst minimalen Aufwand bei der Erstellung, wie bei der Wartung und bin daher bei Hugo gelandet.

item.title: ğŸ’¡ Why this website is the way it is
item.description: Website builders: There are now so many like a dime a dozen. When I asked myself how to set up this website, I thought pretty quickly: “Definitely not with Wordpress” Don’t get me wrong, Wordpress is a great solution in some cases. Just not for me. I wanted full flexibility with the least possible effort in the creation, as in the maintenance, and that’s why I ended up with Hugo.
